destinations.add.mcp.step1.title: 1. Configure Connection
destinations.add.mcp.step1.subtitle: Set up your MCP server configuration
destinations.add.mcp.step1.description: Configure your Model Context Protocol (MCP) server to provide AI models with read-only access to your workspace data.
destinations.add.mcp.step2.title: 2. Security Settings
destinations.add.mcp.step2.subtitle: Configure optional security restrictions
destinations.add.mcp.step2.ipDescription: Restrict access to specific IP addresses. Leave empty to allow all IPs.
destinations.add.mcp.step2.domainDescrip: Restrict access to specific domains. Leave empty to allow all domains.
destinations.add.mcp.step3.title: 3. Review & Confirm
destinations.add.mcp.step3.subtitle: Review your MCP server configuration
destinations.add.mcp.step3.warning: This will create a new MCP server and generate an access token for AI models to access your workspace data.
destinations.add.mcp.step4.title: 4. MCP Configuration Ready
destinations.add.mcp.step4.subtitle: Your MCP server is ready to use

destinations.add.mcp.step4.steps.2: Add it to your MCP client's configuration file (e.g., Claude Desktop settings)
destinations.add.mcp.step4.steps.4: Your AI assistant will now have read-only access to your workspace data

destinations.add.mcp.step4.securityNote: Keep your bearer token secure. This token provides read-only access to your workspace data. If compromised, revoke it immediately from your API keys management page.
destinations.add.mcp.permissions.queryOb: Read access to workspace objects and data
destinations.add.mcp.permissions.graphql: Execute GraphQL queries through the API gateway
